comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment:
This means that the AbsenceCaseProcessRules needs to know about the phases of the AbsenceProcess. Wouldnt it be nicer to have
getAbsenceCaseProcessService.isInClosedPhase() getAbsenceCaseProcessService.isInCompletionPhase()
and hide the access to the actual enums? It would also make this code easier to read.
You dont have to do it in this review, if you want to create a refactor JIRA and link it here.
I did similar for ServiceAgreementCaseService.getActiveServiceAgreement(), based on commennt from Jose, where previously it was ServiceAgreementCaseService.getServiceAgreement(String stageName), meaning the caller needed to know the stage. I like the result, and I think it would work well here too.

comments.author: Sergio Torres
comments.comment: It seems a better approach, I'll do it as part of the review.

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment:
Cool, these are much nicer I think.
Last point, I promise...shouldnt we have unit tests for these 3 in AbsenceCaseProcessServiceTest? We just need to check that each calls isProcessInPhase with the expected enum and returns the result
